lenders.name: Jason & Stevie
lenders.loan_because: We don't agree with lenders making profits when there are private individuals who are willing to take on the risk to help a fellow entrepreneur.
lenders.occupational_info: Jason designs and programs websites. Stevie works in the library at a local University.

lenders.name: Elise
lenders.loan_because: I am excited to help in this small way!  I am especially interested in giving back to women in the Dominican Republic, after being the recipeint of so much hospitality while living there for 2 years as a Peace Corps member.

lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.loan_because: "A hundred times every day I remind myself that my inner and outer life depends on the labors of other men, living and dead, and that I must exert myself in order to give in the measure as I have received and am still receiving." - Albert Einstein

lenders.name: Hibbary
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people.
lenders.occupational_info: I draw and paint.   Constantly.  ha ha

lenders.name: Sakthi
lenders.loan_because: it gives these entrepreneurs the opportunity they deserve

lenders.name: Lene
lenders.loan_because: I do hope that I help to make a difference to the people I make a loan

lenders.name: Kip
lenders.loan_because: This is a way to make a tangible difference in someone's life.  We need to help out wherever we can and as often as we can to those less fortunate than us.
lenders.occupational_info: I manage people, process and technology to make life better for my company.

lenders.name: Michelle
lenders.loan_because: I want to help make things better
lenders.occupational_info: I write stories for children

lenders.name: Andrew
lenders.loan_because: I feel that investing in a person in another country demonstrates a trust and connection far beyond making a simple donation.  A small amount of my pay each month can help several businesses succeed.
lenders.occupational_info: I design robots that are sent to Mars.

lenders.name: Andrea
lenders.loan_because: I am passionate about women's economic, social and political empowerment and I want to contribute to helping achieve sustainability of women in the developing world, and especially in Africa.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a young lawyer and I work in aircraft finance, which means that I work on contracts that arrange lending of money to aircraft operators, like airlines,  to buy the aircraft or to lease aircraft. However my first job as a lawyer was in Botswana, Africa and that is where my passion for Africa and women's empowerment began.

lenders.name: April & Gabe

lenders.name: Joel
lenders.loan_because: I enjoy helping people accomplish their goals.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with computer systems.

lenders.name: Janet

lenders.name: Alaina
lenders.loan_because: To quote Mahatma Ghandi: Start by being the change you want for the world. I like that because a lot of people talk about transformation of all kinds but really it has to start from oneself.  If we all lived the change that we want for the world, we'd see amazing results.
lenders.occupational_info: I design websites and create wallpaper murals, brochures and other print materials for individuals and companies.  I'm also an energy healer.  I used to work in the hotel/restaurant industry and also in public libraries.

It feels much more effective than lending to a larger organization and not being able to see the results. I think the  direct connection between lenders and recipients that Kiva provides will encourage more lending.

lenders.name: Diane
lenders.loan_because: I want to help

lenders.name: David

lenders.name: Gideon
lenders.loan_because: Micro-lending has not only proven to be one of the most effective ways of working toward an egalitarian world economy, but it is a way that individuals can truly affect change. It is a basic human right to have access to credit.

lenders.name: Casey
lenders.loan_because: i enjoy the giving of money

lenders.loan_because: it's the right thing to do

lenders.name: Steven

dana is artist

lenders.occupational_info: I work at the central bank of the United States (the Federal Reserve) as an economics researcher.  In a nutshell, I use statistics and economic models to stuy how macroeconomies fluctuate (prices, employment, production, etc).

lenders.name: Robert
lenders.loan_because: Ever since "60 minutes" did a story on micro loans in Bangledesh 16 years ago, I have always loved the idea. Now, thanks to the people at Kiva, I can easily get involved in what should be an enormously successful movement.

lenders.name: Dr. Deena
lenders.loan_because: Microfinance works

lenders.loan_because: I want to give someone the chance to make a better life for themselves and to help them become a productive and economic benefit within their community. Unity and equality through the organic growth of economics. When we help others, we help ourselves. It's a worthwhile investment.
lenders.occupational_info: I drive a flatbed tractor trailer across country. I go to many places and deliver lumber and steel and other construction materials. I have been doing this since 1989.

lenders.loan_because: I have received so much during my short lifetime.

lenders.loan_because: I enjoying helping others.

lenders.occupational_info: Always working on the lifelong task of being a decent human being on the planet.

1. The difference between offering a helping hand and a handout.
2. That the more positive contacts they make with the rest of the world the better their future will be.

lenders.loan_because: I know how much it means to get the money you really need.

lenders.loan_because: I have been blessed to have more than enough and I want to be a blessing to others.

lenders.loan_because: my money is God's money and so it is only fair to share it....
lenders.occupational_info: I am here to spread the love of christ

lenders.name: Barger family
lenders.loan_because: I like the idea, that in some small way, I may be helping someone gain independence and improve their life.  Chase the dream....
lenders.occupational_info: I provide support to scientists developing novel approachs to the challenges facing the world today.

lenders.name: Jonathan
lenders.loan_because: I spent the summer after my first year of law school working at the Forum for Women, Law, & Development in Kathmandu, Nepal. I was able to see firsthand the difficulties faced by people in developing countries. Microfinance loans are one of the most effective ways to improve someone's quality of life.

lenders.name: Jack & Kay
lenders.loan_because: God has been good to us and we wish to help make an  difference in this world.

lenders.name: Nathan
lenders.loan_because: I want to feel like I'm giving back.  I want to use my success as a means to help others.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in an academic research lab

lenders.name: Amos
lenders.loan_because: I believe in people who make the efforts and take the opportunities to better their lives and those around them.
lenders.occupational_info: I help businesses and organizations make better use of their information and assets.

lenders.name: Eric
lenders.loan_because: even though the sun might be shining outside of my window...somewhere in the world the rain is coming down hard on someone else's "day".

lenders.name: Only4Him
lenders.loan_because: all good things come from the Lord. I am giving to others because it pleases Him!
lenders.occupational_info: I teach fourth grade students. I also travel around the world telling others about God.

lenders.name: Helen and Matt
lenders.loan_because: We loan because we want to help people in need.

lenders.name: Adams Family
lenders.loan_because: We love teaching our children how great it is to help others and to learn about different parts of the world!  By small and simple things, great things are brought to pass.

lenders.name: Ken & Art
lenders.loan_because:
May, 2007: Seems like a powerful idea to enable people to help themselves to build the lives they want.  We're definitely going to give this a try....

Update: September, 2007.  Lending funds to small businesspeople in developing countries has proven to be even more rewarding than we expected.  Each of the worthy borrowers has repaid a good share of the loans and all are successful enough to meet the monthly payment schedule.  We enjoy reading the reports of their success.  When the loans are fully repaid, we'll re-lend the funds to more hardworking small businesspeople around the world.

Update: October 2007.  More than half of the entrepreneurs in our portfolio have already repaid 50% or more of their small  starter loans.  We enjoy reading the updates on their businesses.

Update: January, 2008.  Our first loan to a woman in Nigeria has been fully repaid and we reloaned the money to a group of women in Pakistan.

Update: March 2008.  Well this experiment is really working well.  5 of our original loans have already been paid back in full and we've reloaned the funds to other businesswomen and also made some more loans with new funds.  

We love food and particularly love MEAT.  So lately, we've focused our lending portfolio on the women who make the world a better place through meat.  Check out the photos of knife-wielding ladies from Peru to Nigeria to Cambodia and beyond, purveyors of Beef, Pork, Guinea Pigs, Goats, and more.  We tip our hats to Kiva for the great meat and animal photos.  Kiva really is making the world a better place: capitalism and carinvorism, an idea we can really get behind.

May 2008:  We've been Kiva lenders for a year now and it has worked out great.  

September 2008:  We joined Kiva Community Team Vermont...Jeezum Crow!  Click here to Join:

http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=community&action=viewTeam&team_id=215

May 2009:  It's been two years and we've done 38 loans so far.  The experience has been great, and we can recommend Kiva to all our friends.  This is so much better than sending food because it helps people become self-sufficient.

July 2009:  Meat is good business around the world.  And we don't lend to commies.  Sorry Viet Nam, you're on your own.  42 loans so far.

September 2009:  47 loans so far. More lady butchers from Mongolia to Peru.

April 2010:  57th loan went to Gregoria in Bolivia.

October 2010:  69th loan went to Magdalena in Philippines to raise delicious pigs.

October 2011:  Up to 102 loans so far.  Meat & fish by women around the world.  
June 2013:  We've loaned $2,950 so far with Kiva.
lenders.occupational_info: Ken comes up with new ideas for businesses and Art is a  Geologist and Environmental Scientist.

lenders.loan_because: I think this is the best way to impact the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I analyse business, what more can I say.  Mostly inventory costs.

Kiva enables me to reach out and directly help hardworking entrepreneurs, so that they can in turn help themselves, their families, their communities, and our world.
lenders.occupational_info: I grew up on a farm in the state of Missouri, which I still own.  I live in California, in the Silicon Valley and work with many companies to develop new products, services, and technologies.

lenders.loan_because: I want to help others based on the principle: Give fish, that is food for one day. Give a boat and they now are self sufficient.

lenders.loan_because: empower the poor so that they can lead a decent life and help others in the process

lenders.name: Michelle
lenders.loan_because:
I started Lending to Kiva Entrepreneurs in 2007. It has been an amazing experience and I am grateful to be a part of it. 
Basically, you are lending as little as $25 and once the funds are repaid, you may either lend it to another needy person or group or just withdraw the funds.
To me it's a win win deal in help others less fortunate build a life for themselves and their families.
I am an entrepreneur who would like to give everyone the opportunity to make a living through entrepreneurship. 
Giving this opportunity to men and women who don't have the opportunities afforded to me is an honor and a privilege.
I salute them all and my goal is to lend to and help as many people in need as possible.
lenders.occupational_info:
By day I am an ultrasound technician, happy to tell mom's if they are having a boy or girl.
I am a wife and mom to 2 amazing daughters.
The rest of my time is spent as an entrepreneur building an online business.

lenders.name: Sharon
lenders.loan_because: I've travelled all over the world and seen how hard people work to support their families. I'm grateful to be in a position to help make their lives better.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach English to people who have come to the United States to find a better life for themselves and their families.

lenders.name: Sue and Bob
lenders.loan_because: We were successful entrepreneurs and admire others with the entrepreneurial spirit. We are now in a position to help others. It "feels good."
lenders.occupational_info: Our business was to help others through training and development. We worked with individuals and businesses to help them improve and be more successful.

lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.loan_because: I think it is a good way to help those less fortunate than myself.

lenders.name: Kris Loken
lenders.loan_because: it gives me great joy to be able to help in this small way.
lenders.occupational_info: I am retired from USAID and now work on healthcare reform and Middle East peace from my home in West Virginia.

lenders.name: Monica
lenders.loan_because: People need help.  I know what it is like to need support for a business idea.

lenders.occupational_info: Paul is an English teacher and musician. Andrea is a computer engineer. We have been married since 2004 and Jacob Paul was born to us in April 2009. We want to make sure that Jake always knows that he is a global citizen and that by helping anyone he is helping everyone.

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: it helps businesses get started and operate.

lenders.loan_because: I believe in empowering people to make positive changes in their lives. I have been given much...the least I can do is to give a little.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach 15 and 16 year old students World History and European History at a public high school in Texas, USA.

lenders.name: Katja
lenders.loan_because: I want to see people reach their business goals which in turn will improve their quality of life. If I can provide assistance to help them achieve this, I will!

lenders.name: Bobbi
lenders.loan_because: I believe that people who are striving to improve their lives and lives of people around them are the best possible investment.

lenders.occupational_info: We are college students at Asbury College.  JoAnna cleans houses and makes smoothies(blended fruit drinks), and Matt is training to become a financial representative.

lenders.loan_because: I believe in the power of small actions multiplied

lenders.name: Jennie
lenders.loan_because:
I am blessed.


The best portion of a good man's life is his little, nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and of love.

-William Wordsworth

lenders.loan_because: Karma - Helping others makes the world a better place.
lenders.occupational_info: Semi-Retired & Part-time dog sitter.

lenders.name: Erin
lenders.loan_because: I can't imagine the hardships that many of the borrowers face and this is the most direct way to help them achieve a better life.

lenders.name: Huron
lenders.loan_because:
This is how very small businesses can raise non-equity capital. 

They don't have time to market their financial needs to institutions, and financial institutions can't justify pro-active lending to very small businesses.
lenders.occupational_info: Technical writer, Entrepreneur (computer store), Real estate sales and development, University teacher (economics and finance).

lenders.name: George
lenders.loan_because: it feels  right.  Furthermore, I do not have any  qualms with the Kiva method for helping other people.

lenders.name: Daniel
lenders.occupational_info: I am a political science student at emory university and am currently studying globalisation and developmental economics at the university of cape town

lenders.name: Irene
lenders.loan_because: I want to be able to directly help people around the world who need help to care for their families. God has blessed me with so much in this life that I am happy to share my blessings.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with computers. I am going back to school to learn to be a teacher of mathematics. I live with my husband and 11 year old daughter in a house in New Hampshire where we raise chickens and geese where we enjoy the blessings of good health and the love of family and friends.

lenders.name: Viv
lenders.loan_because: I truly believe in giving back to help others.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a self employed owner of a printing company. In my spare time I am also a facilitator for a womens orginization. There is nothing more rewarding then helping a person get on track with their lives.

lenders.name: Julien
lenders.loan_because: I want to share my luck.

lenders.name: Southern Illinois Univ.
lenders.loan_because: As students of international affairs, we acknowledge the difference and impact the little we donate can make to others in less privileged circumstances.

lenders.name: Sharing
lenders.loan_because: Someone needs to.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: Katie
lenders.loan_because:
"Until one is committed, there is hesitancy, the chance to draw back-- Concerning all acts of initiative (and creation), there is one elementary truth that ignorance of which kills countless ideas and splendid plans: that the moment one definitely commits oneself, then Providence moves too. All sorts of things occur to help one that would never otherwise have occurred. A whole stream of events issues from the decision, raising in one's favor all manner of unforeseen incidents and meetings and material assistance, which no man could have dreamed would have come his way. Whatever you can do, or dream you can do, begin it. Boldness has genius, power, and magic in it. Begin it now."

W. H. Murray in The Scottish Himalaya Expedition, 1951/ Goethe
lenders.occupational_info: I work with others to find ways to improve the quality of healthcare.

...I [Almighty God] have chosen: 
to loose the chains of injustice and untie the cords of the yoke,

to share your food with the hungry

Then your light will break forth like the dawn, 
and your healing will quickly appear... [Isaiah 58]
May Jesus bless you!

lenders.loan_because: As a small business owner, I know the value of having people believe in you. Kiva offers me a way to give back and help someone else accomplish their dream.

lenders.name: Andrew and Aimee Ng

lenders.name: Dorothy

lenders.occupational_info: Our mom is always helping others. She's an uber volunteer who is always ready to help sort books for the library, bake cookies, spend time with a friend in need.

lenders.name: Ruth
lenders.loan_because: I have been blessed by people who helped me when I needed it & I want to pass that blessing on to others.
lenders.occupational_info: We are developing a community wind farm...live in the country...loving our life...

lenders.name: Maggie & Jared
lenders.loan_because: Everyone in the world deserves the chance to better themselves and their community.
lenders.occupational_info: Most recently Maggie has been working for the airlines and myself with the railroad.

lenders.name: Kevin
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do
lenders.occupational_info: I work in Human Resources for a Bakery & Cafe Company.

lenders.name: Nancy
lenders.loan_because: I believe everyone has the right to dream.  In my world dreaming means wanting fame and money.  I think it is very humbling when you hear people's hopes are to have enough money to feed their families.  I want to help people help themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student at a University in the USA.

lenders.name: Collette Marthia
lenders.loan_because: I'm grateful that I'm able to provide for myself, and it takes so little to help these people provide for themselves and their families.

lenders.name: Gene

lenders.occupational_info: I'm studying Political Science and Public Law at the university of Heidelberg in Germany as I'm very much interested in Politics and Society,

lenders.name: Jan
lenders.loan_because: I like the idea of helping people that are less fortunate than I am.

lenders.name: Jane

lenders.name: Robin

lenders.name: Tom
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Hayley & Frank
lenders.loan_because: economic prosperity is often key, in these times, for personal growth. When your basic needs have been met, it's easier to extend yourself and lend a hand to those around you. We're privileged to be a link in the chain of human and social development.
lenders.occupational_info:
Acupuncture is an ancient Chinese healing art that uses very fine needles to stimulate the body's own healing mechanism. It's safe, gentle and useful for a wide variety of health issues.

Sound engineering matches music, voices and sound effects to the picture on the screen. It makes video come to life.

lenders.name: James & Jessica
lenders.loan_because: We loan because we believe that every person deserves the opportunity to do what they can for themselves and their families. Kiva allows us to help those who need help, to strengthen families and communities, and to give others the chance to succeed and believe in themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: James is a technical writer by day, but history writing is his true passion, along with a new gig as a screenwriter. Jessica is an attorney for Iowa Legal Aid, which provides free legal services to people with low income.

lenders.name: Lyle
lenders.loan_because: I like food
lenders.occupational_info: PhD student in materials science.

lenders.name: David & Aaron

lenders.occupational_info: David is a lawyer and wants to help others.  Aaron, David's son, helps David find the people to help.

lenders.name: Mara
lenders.loan_because: I love feeling a connection with different people all over the world.  I know it's a small thing, but I enjoy the thought of our lives crossing briefly.

lenders.name: LeTutor

lenders.occupational_info: We teach foreign languages lessons such as Spanish and French to English speaking students.

You will be made rich in every way so that you can be generous on every occasion, and through us your generosity will result in thanksgiving to God

Nice to help somebody directly and anyway money is supposed to move not to sleep in a bank !

lenders.occupational_info: Currently a masters candidate of Global Health at the Rollins School of Public Health in Atlanta.  I will be focusing my research on microfinance and community health & development.

lenders.occupational_info: I run a Children's organziation for my county

lenders.loan_because: I want small business women around the world to be successful

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: We are one world community and no one can ever make it on their own.

lenders.name: Megan
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the power of microloans and am excited that even someone like me, a fresh out of college poor young adult, can contribute and made a significant difference in someone's life.

lenders.name: Emily
lenders.loan_because: I want to support working women.

lenders.name: Bethany

lenders.occupational_info: I am a government attorney

lenders.name: Victoria
lenders.loan_because: Although I may not have much in my pocket, I have enough in my heart. That's what leads me to give to others who need a hand.

lenders.name: ann

lenders.occupational_info: We teach French business people to communicate in English

lenders.name: Davis
lenders.loan_because: This was a group effort by my Business & Society (ethics) class with support from the Unitarian Universalist Fellowship of Beaufort.
lenders.occupational_info: economics professor

lenders.name: Darren
lenders.loan_because: I just want to help out where I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I buy houses for cash and then sell them to people who do not qualify for a regular mortgage due to a problem credit history.

lenders.name: Lori
lenders.loan_because: I care.

lenders.name: Len
lenders.loan_because: my small investment has much more significance in the developing world than it can ever have in my own backyard here in North America.
lenders.occupational_info: I retired in 2012 to focus on writing my science and technology blog. Prior to that I worked with new business start ups, mostly hi-tech, helping them to define their products, services and brand, assisting them with their business and marketing strategies, and helping them secure seed money and first round investment to realize their dream.

lenders.name: Alice
lenders.loan_because: Introducing me to kiva was a wonderful birthday gift that my mother gave to me.  Her small business supported my family and gave me an education.  I would like to share that gift with others.
lenders.occupational_info: I build and repair bicycles in my local bicycle shop.

lenders.name: Keller Middle School
lenders.loan_because: We are 8th graders from Keller Middle School that want to help people build stronger economies around the world.   The graduating class of 2011 loaned money two years ago to Doris Mensah.  Upon her repayment, we chose Ms. Abejide and Ms. Cana's group to "reloan" the money to.  The graduating class of 2012 loaned $450 to 5 different people last spring. The graduating class of 2013 have raised $50 and selected Mr. Traore and Mrs. Aguilar to receive their loan, and with the credit from last year's loans, we were able to select Mrs. Bondzie and Mrs. Srey.  We are excited to watch these businesses grow.
lenders.occupational_info: Teacher:  I teach US History and World Mythology to 14 year olds.  I work with a great group of kids that are interested in their global economy.

lenders.name: Anton & Dana
lenders.loan_because: Our lives are blessed and we want to help others.

lenders.name: Nathan
lenders.loan_because: Jesus taught to love our neighbor and giving to the needy is an active way to do that. I think microloans is a great way to help others and give them the economic freedom and security a small business provides.
lenders.occupational_info: I get to know youth and through those relationship tell them about the love that God has for them. I show them how to follow Jesus and live out his teachings to love God and love others.

lenders.name: Janise
lenders.loan_because: I am blessed by the gifts of others in my life so it only seems right to empower someone else to start or expand their businesses to support themselves and their families.
lenders.occupational_info: Spirit guide to three beautiful children; tax preparation; commercial loans

lenders.name: Brooke
lenders.loan_because: We have so much and it takes so little to make a difference in someone's life.

lenders.name: Katie
lenders.loan_because: it's rad to make a difference!

lenders.name: Mike
lenders.loan_because: I think everyone deserves a chance to make their lives better.

lenders.occupational_info: I teach kids to learn how to read, write and count and I try to make them love the wolrd.

lenders.loan_because: we can..

lenders.loan_because: there are lots of people in the world working harder than I do but getting less money.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach because it is very challenging but rewarding to work with lots of different types of children in the ages between 12 and 18. And I teach biology because I am fascinated by all things of nature since I was small and I think we should appreciate and understand all the organisms in our world (including our own species) a bit more to keep the world alive.

lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.loan_because: Same $25 still going strong!!

lenders.name: Wade
lenders.loan_because: micro-finance has proven itself over the years to be one of the best ways to improve the condition of global citizens.  And it's so personal that you really know where your money is going.
lenders.occupational_info: I am basically a project manager for computer systems.  I'm currently replacing a warehouse management system for a large multi-national corporation.

lenders.name: Richard Stuart
lenders.loan_because: I believe that I can make a difference each and every day.
lenders.occupational_info: I listen with both ears and utilize my life experience to help individuals and groups develop increased self-awareness and insight into their untapped potential.

lenders.name: grant marlier
lenders.loan_because: It makes a difference
lenders.occupational_info: I study at a university in Boston, USA.  I also work for a research institution or think tank.

lenders.name: Hamish
lenders.loan_because: The idea of helping someone fund their dreams moves me.
lenders.occupational_info: I write novels (I've written four so far), which I print myself and bind by hand. I also write articles for a company in Canada that coaches entrepreneurs.

lenders.name: Trent
lenders.loan_because: It's inspiring to see people working so hard to improve their piece of the world.  I appreciate that I can watch their progress.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: Surrounded by so much prosperity, I feel an obligation to help those less fortunate. What I receive in return is always greater than what I give.
lenders.occupational_info: My company publishes Learn the Net, a website that teaches people around the world how to use the Internet.

lenders.name: Charlotte
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people succeed in whatever they want to do!
lenders.occupational_info: I teach writing of all kinds (essays, stories, poems)  at the University of Michigan. I am also a poet.

lenders.name: Erin
lenders.loan_because: The free market can do some pretty amazing things if we all remember to listen to our conscious.

lenders.name: Kraig
lenders.occupational_info: Web Site and Computer Application Development

lenders.name: Charles
lenders.loan_because: This looks like a program that could really help out a variety of people and occupations.
lenders.occupational_info: Was a Physical Education teacher for many years and thought I had the best job imaginable.

lenders.name: Ellen
lenders.loan_because: my sister, Becky Elliott (pictured) died recently and was a hard-working single mom for most of her life.  I do it in her memory.

lenders.name: Joel
lenders.loan_because: I want to help.
lenders.occupational_info: I maintain and repair computer systems, printers, and cash registers.

lenders.name: Tracy
lenders.loan_because: little things can make a big difference.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a health services researcher.

lenders.name: Michelle
lenders.loan_because: I love the idea of helping people who are taking an active role in improving their lives and building sustainable communities.

lenders.name: Nony
lenders.loan_because: I love having a more personal connection to the people who benefit from these loans. I respect and admire the entrepreneurs who have the vision and determination to improve their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a retired nurse and holistic chiropractor with a sub-specialty in nutrition. I now consult with people who want to be healthy and prevent degenerative disease through natural health care and lifestyle.

lenders.name: Jon
lenders.loan_because: My son taught me how to help people in this way.
lenders.occupational_info: I try to help people find a living faith in Jesus Christ, and join me as together we learn more about living Christianly. I think faith is vital to life, and it  can make a real difference in  person's life and world view. Helping others is one of the ways we can reflect God's love.

lenders.name: Emilio
lenders.loan_because: I admire the entrepreneurial spirit and I'm glad I can do a small part to help it grow.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people get their work done

lenders.name: L. Renee
lenders.loan_because: I believe in supporting the entrepreneurial spirit! As a global community we can provide necessary resources to help each other reach our individual potentials!
lenders.occupational_info: I am a seeker and strive to keep my mind open-- there is so much I don't know and so much I would like to learn....

lenders.name: Anna
lenders.occupational_info: professor of writing and literature

lenders.name: Rachel
lenders.loan_because: For my bat mitzvah I received money. I wanted to use it for something that would make a lasting impact.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student.

lenders.name: Alice and John
lenders.loan_because: We have been blessed with faith, family and friends.  Its time to give back with joy!!
lenders.occupational_info: We enjoy family and friends and the wisdom that this is one world and we can all live together in peace.

lenders.name: Travis
lenders.loan_because: I want to be an instrument of grace.  Viva Kiva!

lenders.name: KEN & LINDA
lenders.occupational_info: Ken: retired from the railway now drives a school bus.  Linda: helps immigrants.

lenders.name: Azmina Karmali
lenders.loan_because: i want to make a difference.

lenders.name: Laurie
lenders.loan_because:
I can.  

And so little here goes so far.
lenders.occupational_info: My work involves making a difference in a person's life through my writings.

lenders.name: Cynthia
lenders.loan_because: I like helping small businesses grow and thrive.  My father's small business (and his hard work!) helped to create the wonderful opportunities that I've had in my life, and added greatly to the life of our community.  I'm just paying that gift forward to other small businesses.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a large law firm in Washington, DC.  Law is my second career, and I graduated from law school in 2008 (before that, I worked in information technology).  I've been given some incredible opportunities, so want to "pay it forward" to others.  My wonderful husband Steve and I have been married for fifteen years.  We have not yet been blessed with children but are still hopeful.

lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.loan_because: I feel an obligation to give and hand up to people in need.

lenders.name: Parker
lenders.loan_because: I want to help other people
lenders.occupational_info: I find it intersting and fun learning about butterflys, lady bugs and other creatures. I hope to be a marine biologist.

lenders.name: Robert
lenders.loan_because: I think that giving driven people a hand up is better than a hand out.

lenders.name: Johnathan
lenders.loan_because: It assists others to work for themselves.  The people gain a better life and personal dignity.
lenders.occupational_info: Serving the People of God through ministry.

lenders.name: Douglas
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I build and fix things for people. I enjoy meeting my customers. I'm glad I can help them.

lenders.name: Herbert
lenders.loan_because: globalization must work for everyone.

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: I dream of a world where oppportunities are available to all who are willing to work for them.  This is just the right thing to do!

lenders.name: Meg
lenders.loan_because: I loan because everyone in our world deserves a chance to make the best life possible for themselves and their families.

lenders.name: Barry
lenders.loan_because: I identify with the entrepreneurial mindset, and would jump on any opportunity to help others reach their business goals.
lenders.occupational_info: I study medical device design, how to make systems more effective, more affordable, and less invasive.

lenders.name: Heather and Zac
lenders.occupational_info: Heather is currently a student doctor studying women's health.  Zac works will help with designing better cities in which people can happily live, work and play.  He is also working to develop affordable housing for low income families.

lenders.name: Jill
lenders.loan_because: People helping people. It's powerful stuff.

lenders.name: Jared
lenders.loan_because: I love helping people better their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I help teenagers with severe learning disabilities learn the skills they will need to work well and lead happier lives.

lenders.name: Tamás
lenders.loan_because:
I try to help people when I can, but I have never donated or lent money to any charities before. The reason is that I always had the idea that I have no control over what happens with the money and how much wil be lost on administration and other kosts. 

With Kiva this is all different. I hope to be able to make a difference...
lenders.occupational_info: Born in Hungary, raised in Sweden. Now I am a safety & environmental coordinator at an icecream factory in Holland.

lenders.name: Ted
lenders.loan_because: it helps

lenders.name: deepak
lenders.loan_because: i want to start my own business in real estate.
lenders.occupational_info: i can double d money very easily.. but condition is tht i need money, m very xperienced & gud at real estate business.

lenders.name: ian
lenders.loan_because: People who are prepared to work should always be given the opportunity.
lenders.occupational_info: If you build and use ships or oil rigs you need to show that these are safe to people and the environment. I help companies to do just this.

lenders.name: Robert
lenders.loan_because: I like to give individuals a chance in life. So little, can sometimes go so far. Not just for profit, but for a better life and understaning, with peace of mind.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a quality assurance consultant. At present working in Kuwait. I am British, though I now live in Nanjing, China.

lenders.name: Buffy & Jacob
lenders.loan_because: life is survival of the luckiest. This is our way of adding more luck.
lenders.occupational_info: Diversity consulting and IT consulting.

lenders.name: Holly
lenders.occupation: Live Online Language Trainer & Teacher Trainer
lenders.loan_because: I have been blessed and want to bless others!
lenders.occupational_info: I teach English to non-native speakers of English all over the world via the internet.  In addition, I train language teachers how to use virtual classroom technology.

lenders.name: ukpi
lenders.loan_because: i need to start a poultry farm

lenders.name: Jan
lenders.loan_because: This is a wonderful way to reach out globally and help someone get a start in helping themselves to a better life. I was so impressed with the info I received about Kiva from my son-in-law that I couldn't wait to participate.  We have so much here, sometimes we don't realize how little it takes for us to help change lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a mother of 2 grown daughters, and grandmother to two little girls.  I am a homemaker and live with my husband of 32 years.

lenders.name: Barbara
lenders.loan_because: I believe in helping people reach independence.  Also, I want to help families, so that they can help their children, and we can begin to end the cycle of violence and deprivationn that exists in so much of the world today.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with families whose children have been taken away by the government, because of neglect and/or abuse.  I try to help parents re-unite with their children.

lenders.name: Greg
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people get ahead and succeed in business!
lenders.occupational_info: Our company sells new and used wrist watches.

lenders.name: Stacy & Rich
lenders.loan_because: We are doing our part to acheive the UN MDG's, and we believe that part of our call as Christians is to share what we have with our neighbors around the world.
lenders.occupational_info: We are a married couple who are both priests in the Episcopal (Anglican) church.  We serve the people of God in our congregations and in our larger communities through preaching, teaching, and providing spiritual care.

lenders.name: David
lenders.loan_because: What feels better than helping someone succeed?

lenders.name: Ben and Maggie
lenders.loan_because: I feel so blessed to be able to give my children what they need.  This is such an easy way to help the women of the world to care for their children.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a nurse in a hospital and I care for people who have just had surgery.  I also sew for my children and family.  I take care of my two children and of course, my husband.

lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because: I have had and continue to have a life filled with many blessing. I have never experienced a lack of  basic needs like family, love, friends, good health and financial stability.  I can easily loan some of my money to persons whose needs are critical in trying to move towards a better life.  I am thankful that I found a way of helping others through Kiva.

lenders.name: Brent
lenders.loan_because: Good people everywhere need assistance from time to time. As others have helped me, it is my turn to repay those kindnesses
lenders.occupational_info: I worked full time in informal education and now work on a variety of temporary educational and travel related projects.
